activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 230, Branch 1

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Daniel Kintopf

records.addlTxt:
NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Jesse Daniel Kintopf.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Rae requesting a P/S the beginning of December
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons to include but not limited to firearms. The Court permits the defendant to possess firearms exclusively to fulfill his employment at Jon's Sport Shop in Oshkosh, WI.

Case called @ 11:00 AM Defendant Jesse Daniel Kintopf in court.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Jesse Daniel Kintopf. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NGP entered. Motion for bond modification filed by Atty Rae. Argument by Atty Rae. Argument by DA Leusink. The Court modifies bond to permit DE to possess firearms exclusively to fulfill employment at Jon's Sport Shop in Oshkosh, WI. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 09:10 am.

Case called @ 1:12 PM Defendant Jesse Daniel Kintopf appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by video for Jesse Daniel Kintopf. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE is eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders: $500 cash bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
